title: Aural set, In the Mood - brass rhythm

content.question: Which of the following most nearly represents the repeated rhythm played by the brass section?

choices.label: Choice A has two measures. The time signature of each line is four-four time. The rhythm of measure 1 of option A is: half rest, eighth, eighth, eighth, and eighth with a tie. The rhythm of measure 2 of option A is: half note tied to previous eighth and a half rest.

Choice B has two measures. The time signature of each line is four-four time. The rhythm of measure 1 of option B is: half rest, eighth rest, eighth, eighth, and eighth with a tie. The rhythm of measure 2 of option B is: half note tied to previous eighth and a half rest.

Choice C has two measures. The time signature of each line is four-four time. The rhythm of measure 1 of option C is: half rest, eighth rest, quarter, and eighth with a tie. The rhythm of measure 2 of option C is: half note tied to previous eighth and a half rest.

Choice D has two measures. The time signature of each line is four-four time. The rhythm of measure 1 of option D is: half rest, quarter, and quarter with a tie. The rhythm of measure 2 of option D is: half note tied to previous quarter and a half rest.

content.answer: Choice C has two measures. The time signature of each line is four-four time. The rhythm of measure 1 of option C is: half rest, eighth rest, quarter, and eighth with a tie. The rhythm of measure 2 of option C is: half note tied to previous eighth and a half rest.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
